intro: Hieracium acutifolium, commonly known as the sharp-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive sharp, pointed tip, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
